intro: Keetia purseglovei, commonly known as the Seychelles keetia, is a rare shrub native to the Seychelles. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
